name: Akuoumaru
desc: The beloved sword of the legendary "Akuou." The blade is huge and majestic, but is surprisingly easy to wield.

value.text: For every point of the entire party's combined maximum Energy capacity, the Elemental Burst DMG of the character equipping this weapon is increased by <color=#37ffff>0.12%/0.15%/0.18%/0.21%/0.24%</color> . A maximum of <color=#37ffff>40%/50%/60%/70%/80%</color> increased Elemental Burst DMG can be achieved this way.

customize.name: Sunny Morning Sleep-In
customize.desc: A bell lantern forged from purple jade. They say it brings sweet dreams when placed beside one's pillow.

customize.name: Silvershower Heartstrings
customize.desc: Legendary bow of the fairies. Whether on the stage or the battlefield, it can easily touch the hearts of the listener.

customize.name: Mouun's Moon
customize.desc: A lovely warbow made from seashells and coral. A mournful brilliance flows along its moonlight-colored arms.

customize.name: The Flute
customize.desc: Beneath its rusty exterior is a lavishly decorated thin blade. It swings as swiftly as the wind.

customize.name: Eye of Perception
customize.desc: A dim black glaze pearl that is said to have the power to read the purity of one's heart.

customize.name: Wavebreaker's Fin
customize.desc: A naginata forged from luminescent material deep in the ocean depths. It was once the possession of the tengu race.

customize.name: Akuoumaru
customize.desc: The beloved sword of the legendary "Akuou." The blade is huge and majestic, but is surprisingly easy to wield.

customize.name: Verdict
customize.desc: A weapon once used by a young maiden who forsook her family name, stained with the blood of enemies and loved ones both.

customize.name: Mistsplitter Reforged
customize.desc: A sword that blazes with a fierce violet light. The name "Reforged" comes from it having been broken once before.

customize.name: Mouun's Moon
customize.desc: A lovely warbow made from seashells and coral. A mournful brilliance flows along its moonlight-colored arms.

customize.name: The Flute
customize.desc: Beneath its rusty exterior is a lavishly decorated thin blade. It swings as swiftly as the wind.

customize.name: Favonius Codex
customize.desc: A secret tome that belonged to the scholars of the Knights of Favonius. It describes the logic and power of elements and matter.

customize.name: Dragon's Bane
customize.desc: A polearm decorated with an entwining golden dragon. Light and sharp, this weapon may very well kill dragons with ease.

customize.name: Akuoumaru
customize.desc: The beloved sword of the legendary "Akuou." The blade is huge and majestic, but is surprisingly easy to wield.

customize.name: Thundering Pulse
customize.desc: A longbow that was a gift from the Shogun. Eternal lightning crackles all around it.

customize.name: Kagura's Verity
customize.desc: The bells used when performing the Kagura Dance, blessed by the Guuji herself. The scent of the Sacred Sakura tree lingers on it.

customize.name: Rust
customize.desc: A completely rusted iron greatbow. The average person would lack the strength to even lift it, let alone fire it.

customize.name: The Flute
customize.desc: Beneath its rusty exterior is a lavishly decorated thin blade. It swings as swiftly as the wind.

customize.name: The Widsith
customize.desc: A heavy notebook filled with musical scores. Though suffering from moth damage and heavy wear-and-tear, there is still much power to be found among the hand-written words within.

customize.name: Haran Geppaku Futsu
customize.desc: A famed work by the Futsu line of smiths. The name "Haran" comes from the manner in which it resembles the violent, roiling waves.

customize.name: Engulfing Lightning
customize.desc: A naginata used to "cut grass." Any army that stands before this weapon will probably be likewise cut down...

customize.name: Mouun's Moon
customize.desc: A lovely warbow made from seashells and coral. A mournful brilliance flows along its moonlight-colored arms.

customize.name: Lion's Roar
customize.desc: A sharp blade with extravagant carvings that somehow does not compromise on durability and sharpness. It roars like a lion as it cuts through the air.

customize.name: Sacrificial Fragments
customize.desc: A weathered script, the text of which is no longer legible. A cursed item eroded by the winds of time.

customize.name: Favonius Lance
customize.desc: A polearm made in the style of the Knights of Favonius. Its shaft is straight, and its tip flows lightly like the wind.

customize.name: Akuoumaru
customize.desc: The beloved sword of the legendary "Akuou." The blade is huge and majestic, but is surprisingly easy to wield.

customize.name: Everlasting Moonglow
customize.desc: A string of lovely jasper from the deep sea. It shines with a pure radiance like that of the moon, and just as ever-distant.

customize.desc: A stone dumbbell containing distant memories. Its endless transformations reveal the power within.

customize.desc: A completely rusted iron greatbow. The average person would lack the strength to even lift it, let alone fire it.

customize.name: Favonius Sword
customize.desc: A standard-issue longsword of the Knights of Favonius. When you're armed with this agile and sharp weapon, channeling the power of the elements has never been so easy!

customize.desc: A dim black glaze pearl that is said to have the power to read the purity of one's heart.

customize.name: Uraku Misugiri
customize.desc: This famous blade was once created by the hand of Urakusai, the renowned literatus. Legend has it that it has never cut any living creature in all these hundreds of years.

customize.desc: A famed work by the Futsu line of smiths. The name "Haran" comes from the manner in which it resembles the violent, roiling waves.

customize.desc: A sword that blazes with a fierce violet light. The name "Reforged" comes from it having been broken once before.

customize.name: Freedom-Sworn
customize.desc: A straight sword, azure as antediluvian song, and as keen as the oaths of freedom taken in the Land of Wind.

customize.name: Redhorn Stonethresher
customize.desc: According to its previous owner, this weapon is the "Mighty Redhorn Stoic Stonethreshing Gilded Goldcrushing Lion Lord" that can send any monster packing with its tail between its legs.

customize.name: Mouun's Moon
customize.desc: A lovely warbow made from seashells and coral. A mournful brilliance flows along its moonlight-colored arms.

desc.text:
This blade was once used by a mighty general of Watatsumi.
It is said that he only knew as much of swordsmanship as the "Getsumouun" and "Yuushio" styles he taught himself,
And yet by their grace was he never vanquished by any mortal in a duel or on the field of battle.
It is often said that snakes and fish are both cold-blooded. But cold-blooded creatures ever seek the promised land of warmth.
To see his people's dreams fulfilled, Omikami challenged the gathering storm clouds to war.
Amongst the people of Watatsumi bent upon conquest, a young man stood out from the rest.
His fearless valor won him great love in Watatsumi, and they named him Touzannou.
But after many years passed, his kingly name was forgotten, only to be replaced by the epithet by which his foes knew him:
"Akuou," the wicked fangs and claws of the Great Serpent, the savage, demonic invader of Yashiori Island...
The slaughter had hardened the young man into a warrior. But to him,
Only the wish he made before departing, a wish made upon the moon reflected in the waters beside the shrine, was eternal.
"One day, I shall set myself above Mt. Yougou, overlooking the palace of the Lord of Thunder."
"I will have a joyful showdown against the legendary Great Tengu of Yougou upon the roof of Tenshukaku."
"...And then I'll bring that tengu's mask back to Ayame and Mouun as a souvenir!"
At last, the tides washed all their dreams away like towers in the sand.
The tengu's mask, shining like a crimson star, was shattered like seashore gravel amidst the chaotic battle,
Nor would the shrine maiden who shone like moonlight into the young man's soul ever return again,
While the Akuou himself would face the blinding ray of lightning alongside the Great Serpent.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Coral Branch of a Distant Sea
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Watatsumi Island is the furthest from Narukami Island in the Inazuman island chain, and its name means "the god of the oceans" in the island's ancient tongue. Legend has it that when the great serpent first arose within the abyssal nation of ever-night, its fluorescent body was covered in myriad-colored coral.

materials.name: Concealed Claw
materials.desc:
Residual body tissue left behind by one of the Riftwolves.
By ordinary logic, these objects, so alien to this world, should not have remained behind after these abnormal creatures were excised from the land.

materials.name: Old Handguard
materials.desc:
A battle-worn handguard that was once mounted on an Inazuman blade.
For those adept in the art of the sword, the tsuba is a defense from the edge of an opponent's blade. For beginners, it is a defense made for their own right hand, to protect it from itself.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Jeweled Branch of a Distant Sea
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
This coral cannot be found anywhere in Teyvat, but was a gift that the great serpent obtained when it broke into the Dark Sea. For that abyssal snake, to be filled with coral was to be mighty, and its power would be shaved away as those corals were lost. In other words, those corals contain power far beyond the norm.

materials.name: Concealed Claw
materials.desc:
Residual body tissue left behind by one of the Riftwolves.
By ordinary logic, these objects, so alien to this world, should not have remained behind after these abnormal creatures were excised from the land.

materials.name: Old Handguard
materials.desc:
A battle-worn handguard that was once mounted on an Inazuman blade.
For those adept in the art of the sword, the tsuba is a defense from the edge of an opponent's blade. For beginners, it is a defense made for their own right hand, to protect it from itself.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Jeweled Branch of a Distant Sea
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
This coral cannot be found anywhere in Teyvat, but was a gift that the great serpent obtained when it broke into the Dark Sea. For that abyssal snake, to be filled with coral was to be mighty, and its power would be shaved away as those corals were lost. In other words, those corals contain power far beyond the norm.

materials.name: Concealed Unguis
materials.desc:
Body tissue left behind by one of the Riftwolves.
Though they are quite wondrous indeed, these hunting hounds of "Alfisol" are nothing of note before Durin of "Humus."

materials.name: Kageuchi Handguard
materials.desc:
A handguard mounded upon a sword of some distinction.
Inazuma has a long tradition of sword-making. When making swords, smiths will often make several different weapons at once, before choosing from among them the "shinuchi," or the best weapon, while the others are known as "kageuchi."

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Jade Branch of a Distant Sea
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Fleeing into the Dark Sea, the god that had lost everything met the abandoned people who had nothing within the ocean depths. Thus it elected to remain and become their "Orobashi no Mikoto," their "Watatsumi Omikami."
It is said that the great snake god once broke off all the coral branches on its body to give light to the children who were curled up in the darkness. They also say that it used these coral branches to create a huge ladder to allow those children to once again reach the surface and see the light of day.

materials.name: Concealed Unguis
materials.desc:
Body tissue left behind by one of the Riftwolves.
Though they are quite wondrous indeed, these hunting hounds of "Alfisol" are nothing of note before Durin of "Humus."

materials.name: Kageuchi Handguard
materials.desc:
A handguard mounded upon a sword of some distinction.
Inazuma has a long tradition of sword-making. When making swords, smiths will often make several different weapons at once, before choosing from among them the "shinuchi," or the best weapon, while the others are known as "kageuchi."

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Jade Branch of a Distant Sea
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Fleeing into the Dark Sea, the god that had lost everything met the abandoned people who had nothing within the ocean depths. Thus it elected to remain and become their "Orobashi no Mikoto," their "Watatsumi Omikami."
It is said that the great snake god once broke off all the coral branches on its body to give light to the children who were curled up in the darkness. They also say that it used these coral branches to create a huge ladder to allow those children to once again reach the surface and see the light of day.

materials.name: Concealed Talon
materials.desc:
A sharp nail left behind by one of the Riftwolves.
All the marvels in the world must pale before "Cretaceus," the greatest work of them all.

materials.name: Famed Handguard
materials.desc:
An intricately-made handguard that was mounted upon a famed weapon.
Some believe that swords have souls and lives of their own, and thus deserve their own names. Those who love their blades will be acknowledged by them in turn. But those who see their swords as friends or even lovers should be warned that this relationship is built on death and bloodshed. The passions of those who dance with their blade amid crimson showers must surely be cooled someday by fickle steel.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Golden Branch of a Distant Sea
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The meaning that lies behind the name "Watatsumi" is simply the unrequited hopes that the abandoned people who dwelt in the deep sea pinned upon the serpent god that led them.
And it was also because the serpent god now had people who worshiped it that it stayed in the world it should have long fled, breaking off the coral branches that adorned its body, treading upon land where it should not have, and facing a foe it could never hope to match — till at last, its divine form was sundered along with the mountains, its ichor turned into plasma, and its will and power became a curse that could never be extinguished: Tatarigami.

materials.name: Concealed Talon
materials.desc:
A sharp nail left behind by one of the Riftwolves.
All the marvels in the world must pale before "Cretaceus," the greatest work of them all.

The passions of those who dance with their blade amid crimson showers must surely be cooled someday by fickle steel.
